title: Installaton issue: hwloc
body:
---
I am attempting to install 3 versions of openmpi built with gcc@6.4.0, gcc@8.2.0, and pgi@18.10 on centos7.  Cuda support is essential. Currently every install encounters an error with hwloc. 

When using gcc:
```console
$ spack install openmpi@3.1.3%gcc@4.8.5+cuda+cxx_exceptions fabrics=auto ~java~legacylaunchers~memchecker~pmi schedulers=auto ~sqlite3+thread_multiple+vt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
    ^hwloc@1.11.11%gcc@4.8.5~cairo+cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        ^cuda@10.0.130%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        ^libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^libtool@2.4.2%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^pkgconf@0.27.1%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        ^libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@4.8.5~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^libiconv@1.15%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^xz@5.2.4%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^zlib@1.2.7%gcc@4.8.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
        ^numactl@2.0.12%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^automake@1.13.4%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 
            ^m4@1.4.16%gcc@4.8.5 patches=c0a408fbffb7255fcc75e26bd8edab116fc81d216bfd18b473668b7739a4158e +sigsegv arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
... # and the relevant part of the error message
1 error found in build log:
     257    checking cuda_runtime_api.h presence... yes
     258    checking for cuda_runtime_api.h... yes
     259    checking if CUDART_VERSION >= 3020... yes
     260    checking for cudaGetDeviceProperties in -lcudart... no
     261    configure: WARNING: Specified --enable-cuda switch, but could not
     262    configure: WARNING: find appropriate support
     263    configure: error: Cannot continue

```
When using pgi
```console
$ spack install openmpi@3.1.3%pgi@18.10+cuda+cxx_exceptions fabrics=auto ~java~legacylaunchers~memchecker~pmi schedulers=auto ~sqlite3+thread_multiple+vt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
    ^hwloc@1.11.11%pgi@18.10~cairo+cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
        ^cuda@10.0.130%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
        ^libpciaccess@0.13.5%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^libtool@2.4.2%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^pkgconf@0.27.1%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^util-macros@1.19.1%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
        ^libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@4.8.5~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^libiconv@1.15%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^xz@5.2.4%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^zlib@1.2.7%gcc@4.8.5+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
        ^numactl@2.0.12%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^autoconf@2.69%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^automake@1.13.4%gcc@4.8.5 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64 \
            ^m4@1.4.16%gcc@4.8.5 patches=c0a408fbffb7255fcc75e26bd8edab116fc81d216bfd18b473668b7739a4158e +sigsegv arch=linux-centos7-x86_64

... # and the relevant part of the error message
2 errors found in build log:
     19    checking whether GID '0' is supported by ustar format... yes
     20    checking how to create a ustar tar archive... gnutar
     21    checking whether make supports nested variables... (cached) yes
     22    checking for style of include used by make... GNU
     23    checking for gcc... /apps/spack/lib/spack/env/pgi/pgcc
     24    checking whether the C compiler works... no
    25    configure: error: in `/tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-M2LwRW/hwloc-1.11.11':
    26    configure: error: C compiler cannot create executables
     27    See `config.log' for more details
```
### Platform and user environment


```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux  3.10.0-957.5.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Feb 1 14:54:57 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core) 

``` 
and, if relevant, post or attach:

- `packages.yaml`
```console
packages:
  all:
    compiler: [gcc, pgi]
    providers:
      D: [ldc]
      awk: [gawk]
      blas: [openblas]
      daal: [intel-daal]
      elf: [elfutils]
      fftw-api: [fftw]
      gl: [mesa, opengl]
      glu: [mesa-glu, openglu]
      golang: [gcc]
      ipp: [intel-ipp]
      java: [jdk]
      jpeg: [libjpeg-turbo, libjpeg]
      lapack: [openblas]
      mkl: [intel-mkl]
      mpe: [mpe2]
      mpi: [openmpi,mvapich2]
      opencl: [pocl]
      openfoam: [openfoam-com, openfoam-org, foam-extend]
      pil: [py-pillow]
      pkgconfig: [pkgconf, pkg-config]
      scalapack: [netlib-scalapack]
      szip: [libszip, libaec]
      tbb: [intel-tbb]
      unwind: [libunwind]
    permissions:
      read: world
      write: user
 
  # System Provided Packages

  autoconf:
      paths:
          autoconf@2.69: /usr
      buildable: False

  automake:
      paths:
          automake@1.13.4: /usr
      buildable: False

  bzip2:
      paths:
         bzip2@1.0.6: /usr
      buildable: False

  cmake:
      paths:
         cmake@2.8.12.2: /usr
      buildable: False

  libarchive:
      paths:
         libarchive@3.1.2: /usr
      buildable: False

  libtool:
      paths:
         libtool@2.4.2: /usr
      buildable: False

  m4:
      paths:
          m4@1.4.16: /usr
      buildable: False

  openssl:
      paths:
          openssl@1.0.2k-fips: /usr
      buildable: False

  perl:
      paths:
         perl@5.16.3: /usr
      buildable: False

  pkgconf:
      paths:
         pkgconf@0.27.1: /usr
      buildable: False

  tar:
      paths:
         tar@1.26: /usr
      buildable: False

  zlib:
      paths:
         zlib@1.2.7: /usr
      buildable: False
  # Non-system packages, but only use system compiler to build them

  bison:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  diffutils:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  gdbm:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  gmp:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  help2man:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  libpciaccess:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

#  libuuid:
#      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  libxml2:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  mpc:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  mpfr:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  ncurses:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

#  psm:
#      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  texinfo:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]

  util-macros:
      compiler: [gcc@4.8.5]
```

- `compilers.yaml`
```console
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos7
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@4.8.5
    target: x86_64
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos7
    paths:
      cc: /apps/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/pgi-18.10-iowxswnjenwwdz624rixau2zmh5wyjzd/linux86-64/18.10/bin/pgcc
      cxx: /apps/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/pgi-18.10-iowxswnjenwwdz624rixau2zmh5wyjzd/linux86-64/18.10/bin/pgc++
      f77: /apps/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/pgi-18.10-iowxswnjenwwdz624rixau2zmh5wyjzd/linux86-64/18.10/bin/pgf77
      fc: /apps/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/pgi-18.10-iowxswnjenwwdz624rixau2zmh5wyjzd/linux86-64/18.10/bin/pgf90
    spec: pgi@18.10
    target: x86_64
```

to the issue

$ spack spec --install-status <ABOVE GCC>
Input spec

Rebuilding the package with the following options:
```console
$ spack -d install -j 1 <spec>
...
```
will provide additional debug information. After the failure you will find two files in the current directory:

1. `spack-cc-<spec>.in`, which contains details on the command given in input 
    to Spack's compiler wrapper
